clinical_study.brief_title: the Impacts of Theta-burst Stimulation on Children and Adolescents With Autism Spectrum Disorder
clinical_study.official_title: the Impacts of Theta-burst Stimulation Over Posterior Superior Temporal Sulcus on Children and Adolescents With Autism Spectrum Disorder

brief_summary.textblock: The investigator would like to investigate the impact of theta-burst stimulation over posterior superior temporal sulcus in children and adolescents with autism spectrum disorder

primary_outcome.measure: Changes of total scores of Autism spectrum quotient
primary_outcome.time_frame: baseline; during TBS (4 weeks after baseline); post TBS (8weeks after baseline); One month follow up (4 weeks after post TBS)
primary_outcome.description: parents' report questionnaire for autism clinical severity

primary_outcome.measure: Changes of total scores of Social communication questionnaire
primary_outcome.time_frame: baseline; during TBS (4 weeks after baseline); post TBS (8weeks after baseline); One month follow up (4 weeks after post TBS)

primary_outcome.description: parents' report questionnaire for autism clinical severity (score range:65-260)(Higher scores represent a worse outcome)

primary_outcome.measure: Changes of total scores of Repetitive Behavior Scale-Revised

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- autism spectrum disorder, confirmed by ADOS
Exclusion Criteria:
- current and past systemic disease
- current and past major psychiatric disorders including schizophrenia, bipolar affective disorder and major depressive disorder
- current and past brain injuries
- intelligence < 70
- seizure history
- pregnant
